text:
Last time we talked a lot about Shalltear's
creation and her... "Preferences"

And I ended up by
asking the question

If she is a vampire who
has the inherent ability
To turn people in her obedient slaves

Then... why go through all this process
of abuse, to achieve the same outcome

Well, let's answer that and then
go over the rest of the details
That went into making Shalltear

This paradoxical fusion between
a sadistic predatory vampire
And a goofy adorable little girl

Yea... I know what you
are thinking BUT... YES...

That side of her does exists,
we just haven’t covered it yet

But first, this video
is sponsored by ELSWORD

A F2P, 2.5D side
scrolling action mmorpg
Featuring both PVE and PVP

Across now 13 different
customizable characters

Each with their own classes that
affect both game-play mechanics and lore
It's very easy to pick up

And I personally found that it
caters well to both Casual Gamers

With it's story mode and
quick lvl progression

As-well hardcore players
with the PVP Arena

And given that there
are 13 characters

Each with their own Skill,
Intros, Stories, Artwork & Icons

There's definetly a lot
to take in with this game

Speaking of which,
ELSWORD also just recently

Added their newest
character name Laby
A hybrid brawler & range fighter

Equipped with her fists and her best
friend that doubles as a sentient mirror
That fires projectiles

Her story is independent from the
main characters story-line of the game

Providing for a brand
new starting area & lore

That brings with it new Asian
mythology inspired monsters & zones
So if any of that interests you

Then go ahead and tryout
ELSWORD and Laby for free today

Through the link
in the description
Now, Let's begin...

So, why doesn't Shalltear
use her vampire abilities
To just turn people into slaves?

Well it's long been argued
that vampires are an allegory
To sexual domination and abuse

What I mean by that, is that
the very idea of a vampire

Could be seen as a symbol
of fantasy and fiction

That hides another deeper or in
this case somewhat darker concept

It's able to hint at those
concepts through abstraction

The quintessential vampire, typically steals
into the homes of young women each night

Slowly draining their blood and
in the process corrupting them

Turning them into
fellow vampires who

End up also feeling the
need to create new victims

It's often said that
only those who are pure
Can be turn into vampires

And those who are not, end up
becoming dilapidated husks or zombies

Symbolically speaking then the
vampire's ability to corrupt
Thus works best on the innocent

They're this creature of the
night that slowly builds an army

Of lesser vampires
to do their every bidding

So what's not to say that
one of the purposes of them
Is for a harem of submissive slaves

Of course no fictional
works with the vampires

Is as blatant in that regard
as overlord is with Shalltear

But the way overlord
portraits this

Fits very well to
Peroronchino's Characteristics

He didn't what his NPC to be
symbolic or hint at his fetiches

No... he wanted
her to EMBODY them

And so while Shalltear has the power
to build herself a harem of slaves

Via enthralling eyes
or draining their blood

She's still quite inclined to indulge
in those traditional methods of abuse

And domination to
accomplish the same goal

As a matter of fact... It's
one of her favourite hobbies

What we have with Shalltear is
not an allegory that merely hints
At there darker aspects of domination

She is a being that is
paradoxically both a vampire

As well as what the vampire is
meant to symbolically allude to...

You see... Overlord is
meant to be a somewhat

Comedic take on traditional
villain archetypes

But Shalltear illustrates for
us exactly what it might take

For a villain to actually create
the kind of servants that Ainz has

It's in contrast to how other servants are
gained on accident or through coincidence
Or even magical powers

There's an amusing parallel
to be made here with
Ainz's relationship with the NPCs

Not only is the deeply engrained
loyalty and dependance quite similar
But in case you didn’t noticed

Ainz's has something of his own
harem between Aura, Shalltear & Albedo

And it's also a frequent
joke in the light novel that

Even the male guardians would
go for Ainz if he demanded it

As if They too would be more
than willing to join his harem

This of course being another
extension of their deep loyalty

Which brings us to Shalltear's
relationship with Ainz

This is the side of Shalltear
that we see the most of

Much like Albedo, she
fantasies about being with Ainz

But unlike Albedo she acts
quite submissive around him

We saw this most clear
from her face of enjoyment

during the famous
Shallchair scene

But... That's not the only incident
where she express that type of enjoyment

Back when Ainz first
entered the new world

He had a but of a mix-up
with his Aura Of fear

An Undead Passive Ability that subjects
nearby targets with a minor de-buff

He had accidentally
blasted the guardians

Including Shalltear with
this intimidating aura

And Shalltear claimed that
it made her very... Moist...

Not only that, one of the first
lines that she ever utters to Ainz
Refers to him as her master

The only persona who
she can't rule over

Coming across as if she is exited
that she can't dominate him
Which makes you wonder then

Why would someone who is
soo abusing and domineering

Also enjoy being
abused and dominated

She doesn't really come across as the type
who's willing to be submissive to others
So why would Peroronchino

Create a Dominatrix fantasy
but make her submissive as-well

What did Peroronchino
designed her to be

All good questions that
we can really only answer
By looking at Peroronchino

For starters... It's pretty clear
that he had an interest in Yuri

And that made it's way
into Shalltear as outlined

By her noted experiences with
the vampire brides and Arsh

So it wouldn’t be wrong to say that
she was intended to be a lesbian
But that's not all there is
Here is the important part

Do you really think that
a guy like Peroronchino

Would create a Character
that meet's his Every Desire

And not have them attracted
to him in any way?
OF-COURSE NOT!

Peroronchino's
ideal fantasy women
Is primarily into other women
Yes... But one who swings both ways

And in turn would also be
willing to sleep with him
Put simply... He created Shalltear

To enjoy the things
that he enjoys

As-well as look like the things
that he is personally attracted to

If that's the case
then what FACT

Did he most likely buried
deep in Shalltears Biography

What ultimate fantasy did
Peroronchino imbue withing her

If we put all the
clues together

Then that would be that
Shalltear would be amenable
To becoming his own personal slave

Or just to say any of the
Supreme Ones for that matter

Just like how Shalltear enjoys
using her power & authority
To torment her underlings

Perhaps Peroronchino wrote for Shalltear
to respect the power of the supreme ones

As well as desire to
be dominated by them

Then again Momonga and
Peroronchino where good friends

So maybe Peroronchino wrote that Shalltear
would just go for him specifically

Anyway what we can
gather from this is that

Just like she punishes
her underlings

So too does she expect to be
punished for her own failings

Clearly Albedo was on to
something when she suggested that

Punishment would be the
best way to rescue Shalltear

From her depression after
the events of season one

Now regarding
those very failures

Let's talk about how they've
influenced her character

You might not have realized this but...
She's actually had a bit of a character arc

Going on in the background. Which is more
developed later on in the light novel

One which due to various
canonical changes

Wasn't really present
in the web novel

You see... Shalltear was
quite the arrogant vampire

And while that is a common
trait amongst vampires

This tendency towards arrogance
is also shared by most of the NPCs

They view themselves
as inherently superior

To those not created
by the supreme ones

Though fairly warranted given
their nearly god-like powers

That said Shalltear has an
interesting dynamic to this arrogance

that you wouldn’t find in
someone like Albedo or Demiurge

You see Shalltear is
actually kind of dumb

Initially this could've been
chalked up to overconfidence

In her own
capabilities and power
Since she is a Min-Max LVL 100 NPC
You can attribute this to the fact that...

Peroronchino was
also a power gamer

Don't forget even though I
spent the entire first video

And the begining of this one
talking about how cultured he was

He was still an active member
of a top guild of YGGDRASIL

As such he relentlessly tinkered
with his Build and Equipment

In order to squeeze just a
little more power out of it

He would forgo any sense of cosmetics
or esthetics on his equipment

If it meant coming at the cost
of his game-play performance

So it's no surprise that he designed
Shalltear to be the ultimate
1V1 Fighter

though more information
on that would be discussed

When we talk about how strong
she is in the next video

What you need to know now
is that, aside from Rubedo

She can beat anyone
in Nazarick in a 1V1

Disregarding the fully equipped
& prep version of Ainz Of-course

So when Ainz sent her off into
the kingdom back in season 1

With orders to track down a mage
or a warrior with powerful abilities

Shalltear didn't think to have
any contingencies or back-up plans

She simply didn't think
it was a possibility that
She'd encounter an unforeseen situation

Or powerful foe that could
damage her chances of success

It's not like that was even a
particularly bad assumption on her part
For instance in the light novel

The bandit camp that she raided had
filled the surrounding forest with traps

And her vampire brides had
repeatedly stumbled into them

Since they didn't have any Rogue or
Ranger levels to detect them with

Still given their high
level and vampiric qualities

Something like a bear trap
wasn't particularly threatening

The traps barely did any damage,
and what little they did do
Rapidly healed

It was incidents like these
and her encounter with Brain

that only reinforced
Shalltear's belief

That she had nothing
to concern herself with

Unfortunately what neither
she nor Ainz anticipated

Was the possibility that
denizens of the new world

Would use a World Item to
by-pass her inherent immunities

And overcome the
Level Difference

As it turns out,
the Slane Theocracy

Has a large quantity
of Powerful Artifacts

From YGGDRASIL Players who arrived
in the new world in centuries past

Including some of the
all powerful world items

Which could overwrite the
rules of the world itself

This was a plot point that wasn't
really prominent in the Anime

But its hinted repeatedly
in the Light Novel that

Ainz wasn't the first Player
to arrive in the new world
Or even the last

It is also hinted that
Player arrive in large groups
Approximately once every century or so

In any case, the Slane
Theocracy Elite Black Ops unit
The Black Scripture

They've been investigating the area due
to a prophesy which foretold a great doom

No doubt having something to do
with Ainz appearance in the area

So by chance they just
happened to encounter Shalltear

One of their members the
elderly woman Lady Kaire

She processed the World Item
"Downfall Of Castle & Country"

And this had the power to bring any
target under the control of the wielder
Altho only one target at a time

And she immediately made the
decision to use it against Shalltear

After seeing the power and
threat the she possessed

Fortunately for Shalltear, she
managed to Grievously wound the caster
Shortly before the effect completed

Leaving Shalltear without
any order's to act on

This resulted in her just standing
there waiting for someone to arrive
Alright so in this case

You can't really blame her for
not anticipating a World Item

No she didn't even
know they existed
But to a mastermind like Demiurge

Her lack of preparation and
caution was obviously flawed

She had no way of knowing for
sure that there was absolutely

Nothing out there to
be concerned about

So the prudent thing to do would had
been to investigate things more carefully

Or at least set up
some contingency plans

For instance, she could've had a minion
on standby to report back to Nazarick
In the case of a disaster

Instead it took significant
time for Nazarick

To realize that her mission
had been compromised

In fact had the Mind Control
been completely successful

The secrecy of Nazarick would
had been greatly compromised

It was because this lack
of basic care and attention that

Demiurge would go on to consider
her a liability and a screw up

Exemplified best during the
raid on the kingdom in season 2

Demiurge had Shalltear wait
in reserve as a back-up unit

Rather than participate
actively in the operation

All the while lecturing and patronizing her
about her inattentiveness and unreliability

She was still assigned to
the mission but Demiurge

Didn't want to place her
in a role of any importance

Just in case she would screw up
and diminish the chances of success

The pre-mind control Shalltear
would of been indignant

And outraged at
these turn of events

I mean even before her
operation on the kingdom
During the ride on the carriage

Sebas had to quietly suggest
that she might not be

a fit for the mission
that she had been assigned
And after hearing this

She became so outraged
at the thought that

She had immediately demanded he
fight to the death in mortal combat
But the Shalltear in season 2

She could only muster up
a little bit of resistance

And stem out a half hearted objection
when Demiurge was patronizing her

Something had clearly changed between
Shalltear of season 1 and season 2

As it turns out being mind
controlled had greatly humbled her
Not only had she failed in her mission

She had turned her weapon upon
one of her beloved supreme ones
And... lost...

Shalltear was not just a failure
as a general purpose servant
Her most vaunted skill and powerful build

Wasn't nearly the trump card
that she believed it to be

She was useless... Both as
a servant to follow orders
But also as a weapon to crush Ainz enemies

And when Demiurge one of the
most intelligent guardians
Began doubting her abilities

She presumed that Ainz
had also lost faith in her

After all if one of the smartest
guardians thought of her as a failure

Wouldn’t the unfathomably smart Ainz
himself think even worse of her

To lose the favour of
one of the Supreme Ones
Her self-confidence was broken

And she spiraled
into a deep depression

Because of this, she
would spend her time

Trying to dull the pain
by drinking at the bar

This only worsened the situation because
this depressive spiral resulted in

Even Ainz beginning to buy
the idea that Shalltear was
Actually a bit incompetent

As such he had ended up putting her in
charge of Nazarick's transportation network

It might sound like an important
duty but it was actually really simple

Her only job was to stand
around Nazarick all day

And wait for someone to
contact her telepathically with

instructions to open up a teleportation
gate to a specific location
So while Cocytus, Aura and Mare where

Off conquering the entirety of
the regions surrounding Nazarick

And Demiurge & Albedo were
running the entirety of Nazarick's
Foreign and domestic operations

The only thing Shalltear was
trusted to do for months on end was
Be a walking portal dispenser

She took to the task as
earnestly as she could

But the assignment was a
huge blow to her self esteem

Even she could realize what
such menial work signified
Even if it was fairly important

It was through this process that
Shalltear's personality began to shift
Ever so Subtly

Her old one where she was always
eager to abuse and dominate others

Was built upon her self
confidence in her own power

This was when her domineering
vampire side was at it's strongest

But when that was all pealed
away, what was she left with?

Well put simply, it was the
other half of her Character

The one that her Visual
Design was meant to allude to
That innocent child-like little girl

To her underlings. Sure she might
be a vicious sociopathic tyrant
But to the other guardians and Ainz

She comes across as a
bit goofy and over eager

She goes from all-powerful tyrant
who is respected and feared

To one that is patronized
and looked down on

Pretty much what could just be summed
up as a cute but childish little girl

I don't want to spoil
any of the light novel

So we will just say
that subsequent volumes

Follow up in this shift
in her character arc
You can look forward to more on that
Anyway

I'm not sure how much
of this side of her was

Actually intended on
the part of Peroronchino

Perhaps he designed her
with this duality in mind

Perhaps his ideal fantasy was a woman who
masked her insecurity and childishness

With a dominant
superiority complex

Perhaps in his fantasies he would
subject Shalltear to the same treatment

She gave to others, and she
would then discover that

She enjoyed being dominated more
than she enjoyed dominating others

Maybe it was a Touhou
Doujin Reference
Or whats most likely

Is that she inherited that aspect
of her personality from him

After all while Peroronchino
was an adult like everyone else

I suspect he was seen
by the other members of

The guild as the most
childish and immature

You could imagine how the
other guild mates viewed him

And it wouldn’t be surprising if goofy
little kid was one of those view points

This tendency was in
no doubt exacerbated

By the fact that his older sister
Bukubukuchagama was also in the guild

She was quite strict
and hard on him

Always lecturing him about
one thing or the other

She was always being embarrassed by
what ever antics he was getting into

On the other hand he
was a comedian type

Who didn't like to take
things too seriously

So she always felt the
need to keep an eye on him

To make sure he
wasn't up to no good

Perhaps because of this, Shalltear inherited
a bit of that childishness as-well

She even tends to be patronized
most prominently by Aura

Who paradoxically finds her
exasperating and annoying

but also can't help but keep
a bit of an eye out for her

I mean she was one of the NPCs
created by Bukubukuchagama

Just as an NPC inherits aspects of
their personality from their creator

NPC relationships also
mirror that of their creators
Hence why Aura looks after Shalltear

Much in the same way that Bukubukuchagama
would look after Peroronchino

though usually they got a bit
of a sibling rivalry going on

As Peroronchino actually wrote
into Shalltear's Biography

That she would constantly
pick fights with Aura

As if to try and guarantee that the two
of them would have this bitter rivalry

This could be what causes
Shalltear to constantly pick fights

Not just with Aura but
with pretty much everyone

As I said last video
she's got quite the temper
Fairly unlike Peroronchino

But I guess that just goes
to show that even though NPCs do

Do adopt some of the
personality from their creator

The bulk of it, it's still
derived from their Biography

Anyway that's everything
about Shalltear as a Character

The paradoxical fusion between
a sadistic predatory vampire
and a goofy cutesy adorable little girl

Pretty much everyone's
favorite fictional Vampire Loli

But be sure to join me next time as
I go over how strong she really is

You already know that's
going to be a good one

Before I go id like to thank ELSWORD
again for sponsoring this video

You can try it out today for free
with the link in the description

anyway as always thank
you soo much for watching

And if you enjoy this type of anime
content then you already know what to do
(Subscribe)
So until next time... ciao
